srb.title: Opisivanje diverziteta iridoida u okviru roda Nepeta L. korišćenjem “omics” tehnologija, u cilju in planta metaboličkog inženjeringa i njihove održive eksploatacije (NEPETOME)
srb.description: Rod Nepeta L. je najveći rod familije Lamiaceae, i jedini predstavnik subfamilije Nepetoidae koji se odlikuje proizvodnjom iridoida. Projekat NEPETOME je inspirisan izuzetnim diverzitetom iridoida u okviru roda Nepeta, kao i njihovim nedovoljno iskorišćenim biopesticidnim potencijalom. Projekat ima za cilj da rasvetli molekularne osnove diverziteta iridoida uporednom analizom transkriptoma i metaboloma hemijski diferenciranih predstavnika roda Nepeta. Prikupljeno znanje biće iskoriščeno u cilju intenziviranja proizvodnje ovih značajnih bioaktivnih jedinjenja u in planta biosintetskim platformama, uz upotrebu najsavremenijih metoda metaboličkog inženjeringa. Jedinjenja od interesa u istraživanjima su iridoidni aglikoni koji su dominantno prisutni kod nekih vrsta ovog roda (stereoizomeri nepetalaktona, dehidronepetalakton), kao i iridoidni glukozid 1,5,9-epideoksiloganinska kiselina. Nedavno su rasvetljeni delovi iridoidnog biosintetskog puta koji vode do formiranja nepetalaktona u vrstama roda Nepeta. U okviru projekta NEPETOME biće rekonstruisani metabolički koraci i geni nizvodno od nepetalaktona i oni koji vode ka iridoidnim glukozidima, i biće definisani faktori koji su bitne odrednice produktivnosti biljaka. Opisivanje diverziteta iridoida na inter- i intra-specijskom nivou daće uvid u hemijsku evoluciju ove grupe jedinjenja u okviru roda Nepeta. Nakon funkcionalne karakterizacije preostalih nepoznatih gena biosintetskog puta, privremenom ili stabilnom koekspresijom većeg broja gena od interesa u homologim ili heterologim sistemima, biće stvoreni preduslovi za intenziviranje proizvodnje iridoida korišćenjem in planta biosintetskih platformi. Projekat NEPETOME ima za cilj održivu proizvodnju sirovog materijala za biopesticidne proizvode, što je u skladu sa evropskim “Bio-based Economy” standardima, koji se zasnivaju na održivom iskorišćavanju bioloških resursa iz obnovljivih izvora.

en.title: Omics-guided disentangling of the iridoid diversity in the genus Nepeta L. for in planta metabolic engineering towards sustainable exploitation
en.description: Nepeta L. is the largest genus of the Lamiaceae family, and the exclusive representative of the subfamily Nepetoidae which produces iridoids. Being inspired by multi-level diversity of iridoid compounds within the genus Nepeta, and by their tremendous but underutilised biopesticide potential, NEPETOME aims to elucidate the molecular background of this diversity by comparatively analysing transcriptomes and metabolomes of chemodiverse Nepeta taxa, and to develop meaningful measures to enhance the supply of these compounds for humanity. The challenge ahead is to take advantages of the gathered knowledge to scale up the production of desired iridoids in planta by adopting state-of-the-art metabolic engineering techniques. NEPETOME will target iridoid aglycones with proven biopesticide potential, which are present as major (nepetalactone stereoisomers) or minor constituents (5,9-dehydronepetalactone), and the dominant iridoid glycoside 1,5,9-epideoxyloganic acid. Components of the core iridoid biosynthetic pathway up to nepetalactone have been recently characterised. However, a lot of work still needs to be done in order to reconstruct gene and metabolic networks downstream of nepetalactone, define regulatory mechanisms that drive the productivity of plants, and explain inter- and intra-species diversity of iridoids in this group of plants. Following functional characterization of remaining unknown genes of the pathway leading to desired iridoids, NEPETOME will adopt multigene engineering strategies to transiently or stably introduce and express the genes of interest into heterologous and homologous plants, and thus make the initial steps towards the large-scale production of Nepeta iridoids in plant factories. NEPETOME focusses on innovative and emerging topics supporting the European goal of Bio-based economy (BBE), and its R&D pipeline will deliver technologies to sustainably produce raw materials for biopesticide products, to conquer the market spaces such as animal and human health, and biological control.
